acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour EC50=74.2mg/L of algae (Scenedesmus) (IUCLID, 2000).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value ( >5000mg/kg) (IUCLID, 2000), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: It is classified into Category 4 based on the lower value (LC50 = 3519ppm) among two rat LC50 = 3519ppm (IUCLID, 2000) and 4264ppm (IUCLID, 2000)(in the source of Priority 2).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: In the reference of Priority 1, there are two rat LD50 values: 396.9mg/kg (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports, 2005) and 500mg/kg (ACGIH, 2001). The lower value (former) was applied to categorize, and it was set as Category 4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 92% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.16 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Liquid at a test temperature, 55degC. Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Ignitable when in a mixture of 13% or less by volume in air. UNRTDG Class: 2.1

gases_under_pressure.hazard_statement: Contains gas under pressure; may explode if heated
gases_under_pressure.rationale: Critical temp: >-50degC (Partially liquid at temperatures above -50degC)

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There are no in vivo mutagenicity or genotoxicity study data using germ or somatic cells, and it is weak positive in the in vitro chromosomal aberration test using a Chinese hamster lung origin cell (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports, 2005). But it was negative in the reverse mutation test using bacterial cells (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports, 2005, ACGIH, 7th, 2001, NTP DB, 2005, IUCLID, 2000, CERI Hazard Data, 1997). Therefore, it was presupposed that it cannot be classified.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It was considered as out of Category since it is not observed in any parameter about reproductive developmental toxicity ad dose of 200 mg/kg/day causing little lethality to parent animals in rat repeated oral toxicity/ preroductive developmental toxicity annexation test (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports, 2005).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description about the humans and the animal (ACGIH and 2001), i.e., that erosion of the corneal epithelium by eyes exposure in humans by the accident, and that in the eye tests to the eyes of the animals, conjunctival bleed and corneal edema and turbidity were obsedved. But the either case was transitory change and recovered within seven days, it was set as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It is mentioned that corrosive to human skin (ACGIH (7th.2001), CERI Hazard Data (1997)). From description that after making human skin contact several minutes, even if washing with soap and water, petechiation was seen, softening of the skin continued for 1 - 2 hours, and desquamation was observed 2 - 3 hours later (ACGIH, 2001), it was set as Category 1A.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that in the two-week inhalation exposure test to the rat, the respiratory mucosal degeneration was observed with the dosage in the Category 2 guidance value range (ACGIH (7th.2001), CERI Hazard Data (1997)), it was classified into Category 2, as the target organs were considerd to be respiratory tracts.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: From description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) that RD50 (concentration which a mean respiratory rates reduces by half) of sensory stimulation was 61ppm in inhalation exposure to mice, it was judged that there was respiratory irritant, and was set as Category 3.
